title: refurbished macbook purchased on ebay
message:
macOS Sierra version 10.12.5

Macbook Pro  mid 2014

Serial No. : C02N162CG3QH


Symptoms:

1. it freezes on the boot menu (apple logo)

2. if it somehow goes through the apple logo, it freezes on the login screen

3. takes 5-10 secs to freeze

4. works okay in safe mode

5. Tried every possible reset method

Any advice??

title: refurbished macbook purchased on ebay
message:
try these...

run ASD by press hold D or Option-D. cant remember which to see what sensors are failing.

try remove airport card or ssd. try run using external osx drive.

different trackpad.

run memtest86

check if the main voltages are stable.


if is a refurb ebay mac then there is a high chance..its probably a liquid damage board. check for corrosion or any rework area.

title: refurbished macbook purchased on ebay
message: If you are within the PayPal protection window, return this shit!

title: refurbished macbook purchased on ebay
message: so external jump drive is not needed for the asd?

title: refurbished macbook purchased on ebay
message: will check on that.. could you tell me why?

title: refurbished macbook purchased on ebay
message:
[USER="417"]point0001cents[/USER] post a separate reply than replying to individual posts because people dont get notifications on those

And because most of the stuff on ebay if it's been worked on is the shit other people couldnt fix ebay is fine as long as you get machines that have not been worked on

title: refurbished macbook purchased on ebay
message:
As someone has just taken your money for a pile of shit and felt no way about it....
Replace everything that works with parts from your shit pile and send it back. You are untouchable as a buyer. Maybe they'll think before selling a pile of shit again......

We had a customers machine in with same freezing issue and thought it was RAM.
It would start in safe mode fine.

When we put the board on another screen the freezing went away. No idea why, EDID maybe?... Who knows but it started working.
We put the shit screen back on there and the freeze was back. After going back and forth with new and old screen we sent it out with a new screen and it never came back.

Anyone know why or want to guess?

title: refurbished macbook purchased on ebay
message: Claim your money back, this is a problem you don't want to fix!
